title: Normed subcomplex vector spaces
content: This section characterizes normed subcomplex vector spaces as subcomplex vector spaces which are also normed vector spaces (that is, normed groups with a positively homogeneous norm). For the moment, there is no need of a special token to represent their class, so we only use the characterization ~ isncvsngp . Most theorems for normed subcomplex vector spaces have a label containing "ncvs". The idiom ` W e. ( NrmVec i^i CVec ) ` is used in the following to say that ` W ` is a _normed subcomplex vector space_, i.e., a subcomplex vector space which is also a normed vector space.

blocks.name: isncvsngp
blocks.content: A normed subcomplex vector space is a subcomplex vector space which is a normed group with a positively homogeneous norm. (Contributed by NM, 5-Jun-2008.) (Revised by AV, 7-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: cnrnvc
blocks.content: The module of complex numbers (as a module over itself) is a normed vector space over itself. The vector operation is ` + ` , and the scalar product is ` x. ` , and the norm function is ` abs ` . (Contributed by AV, 9-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: cnncvs
blocks.content: The module of complex numbers (as a module over itself) is a normed subcomplex vector space. The vector operation is ` + ` , the scalar product is ` x. ` , and the norm is ` abs ` (see ~ cnnm ) . (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 3-Dec-2006.) (Revised by AV, 9-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: cnnm
blocks.content: The norm of the normed subcomplex vector space of complex numbers is the absolute value. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jan-2008.) (Revised by AV, 9-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: ncvspds
blocks.content: Value of the distance function in terms of the norm of a normed subcomplex vector space. Equation 1 of [Kreyszig] p. 59. (Contributed by NM, 28-Nov-2006.) (Revised by AV, 13-Oct-2021.)

  nlmngp(c0)
  ngpds(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, (-g ` c0))
  fveq2d(c5, (c1[(-g ` c0)]c3), (c1[c6](-u(1)[c7]c3)), (c0 ∈(NrmVec ⋂ CVec)∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2))
  syl3an1(c0 ∈(NrmVec ⋂ CVec), c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, (c1[(-g ` c0)]c3)=(c1[c6](-u(1)[c7]c3)), c0 ∈ CMod)
  simplbiim(c0 ∈(NrmVec ⋂ CVec), c0 ∈ CMod, c0 ∈ NrmVec, c0 ∈ CVec)
  elin(c0, cnvc, ccvs)
  cvsclm(c0, c0 ∈ CVec)
  id(c0 ∈ CVec)
  clmvsubval(c0, c1, c2, c3, (-g ` c0), c6, c7, (Scalar ` c0))
  eqid((-g ` c0))
  eqid((Scalar ` c0))
}

blocks.name: cnindmet
blocks.content: The metric induced on the complex numbers. ~ cnmet proves that it is a metric. The induced metric is identical with the original metric on the complex numbers, see ~ cnfldds and also ~ cnmet . (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 5-Dec-2006.) (Revised by AV, 17-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: cnncvsaddassdemo
blocks.content: Derive the associative law for complex number addition ~ addass to demonstrate the use of the properties of a normed subcomplex vector space for the complex numbers. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jan-2008.) (Revised by AV, 9-Oct-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: cnncvsmulassdemo
blocks.content: Derive the associative law for complex number multiplication ~ mulass interpreted as scalar multiplication to demonstrate the use of the properties of a normed subcomplex vector space for the complex numbers. (Contributed by AV, 9-Oct-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnncvsmulassdemo(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmul, c2), co(c0, cmul, co(c1, cmul, c2))))
} = {
  mpan(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmul, c2), co(c0, cmul, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), cclm))
  ax-mp(wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), cclm), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), ccvs))
  cncvs(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
  cvsclm(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), ccvs))
  id(wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), ccvs))
  clmvsass(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), c0, cc, c1, c2, cc, cmul, ccnfld)
  eqcomi(cc, cfv(cbs, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld)))
  cnrbas(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
  eqid(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
  ax-mp(wceq(ccnfld, cfv(csca, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))), wcel(ccnfld, universe))
  cnfldex()
  rlmsca(ccnfld, universe)
  eqtri(cmul, cfv(cvsca, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld)), cfv(cmulr, ccnfld))
  cnfldmul()
  rlmvsca(ccnfld)
  eqcomi(cc, cfv(cbs, ccnfld))
  eqcomi(cfv(cbs, ccnfld), cc)
  cnfldbas()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cnncvsmulassdemo(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℂ ∧ c2 ∈ ℂ)→((c0[×]c1)[×]c2)=(c0[×](c1[×]c2)))
} = {
  mpan((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℂ ∧ c2 ∈ ℂ), ((c0[×]c1)[×]c2)=(c0[×](c1[×]c2)), (ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ CMod)
  ax-mp((ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ CMod, (ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ CVec)
  cncvs((ringLMod ` CCfld))
  cvsclm((ringLMod ` CCfld), (ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ CVec)
  id((ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ CVec)
  clmvsass((ringLMod ` CCfld), c0, cc, c1, c2, cc, cmul, ccnfld)
  eqcomi(cc, (Base `(ringLMod ` CCfld)))
  cnrbas((ringLMod ` CCfld))
  eqid((ringLMod ` CCfld))
  ax-mp(CCfld =(Scalar `(ringLMod ` CCfld)), CCfld ∈ 𝕌)
  cnfldex()
  rlmsca(ccnfld, universe)
  eqtri(cmul, (× `(ringLMod ` CCfld)), (× ` CCfld))
  cnfldmul()
  rlmvsca(ccnfld)
  eqcomi(cc, (Base ` CCfld))
  eqcomi((Base ` CCfld), cc)
  cnfldbas()
}

blocks.name: cnncvsabsnegdemo
blocks.content: Derive the absolute value of a negative complex number ~ absneg to demonstrate the use of the properties of a normed subcomplex vector space for the complex numbers. (Contributed by AV, 9-Oct-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnncvsabsnegdemo(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cabs, cneg(c0)), cfv(cabs, c0)))
} = {
  3eqtrd(cfv(cabs, cneg(c0)), cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0)), cfv(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  fveq12d(cabs, cneg(c0), cfv(cnm, ccnfld), cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cabs, cfv(cnm, ccnfld)))
  eqcomd(cneg(c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  cnfldneg(c0)
  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0)), cfv(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), c0)), wcel(ccnfld, cngp))
  cnngp()
  nminv(ccnfld, c0, cc, cfv(cnm, ccnfld), cfv(cminusg, ccnfld))
  cnfldbas()
  eqid(cfv(cnm, ccnfld))
  eqid(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), c0), cfv(cabs, c0)))
  fveq1i(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), c0, cabs)
  eqcomi(cfv(cnm, ccnfld), cabs)
  cnfldnm()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cnncvsabsnegdemo(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(abs ` -u(c0))=(abs ` c0))
} = {
  3eqtrd((abs ` -u(c0)), (abs ` c0), ((norm ` CCfld)`((invg ` CCfld)` c0)), ((norm ` CCfld)` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  fveq12d(cabs, -u(c0), (norm ` CCfld), ((invg ` CCfld)` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℂ, abs =(norm ` CCfld))
  eqcomd(-u(c0), ((invg ` CCfld)` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  cnfldneg(c0)
  mpan(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((norm ` CCfld)`((invg ` CCfld)` c0))=((norm ` CCfld)` c0), CCfld ∈ NrmGrp)
  cnngp()
  nminv(ccnfld, c0, cc, (norm ` CCfld), (invg ` CCfld))
  cnfldbas()
  eqid((norm ` CCfld))
  eqid((invg ` CCfld))
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((norm ` CCfld)` c0)=(abs ` c0))
  fveq1i((norm ` CCfld), c0, cabs)
  eqcomi((norm ` CCfld), cabs)
  cnfldnm()
}
